article:
'Moeck Musikinstrumente + Verlag' is a leading German manufacturer of recorders
and a music publisher.

The company was founded in 1925 by Hermann Moeck in Celle. In 1960 his son Dr.
Hermann Alexander Moeck took over the business. The current owner is Sabine
Haase-Moeck.

The company produces recorders for beginners and handmade instruments for
soloists. Moeck formerly manufactured historical instruments such as Crumhorn,
Rauschpfeifes, Shawms and Dulcians, but the Renaissance and Baroque Woodwind
Instruments division was closed in December 2008. [http://www.moeck.com/cms/index.php?id=5&L=1 Historical
Woodwind Instruments page]

The publishing is specialized in recorder music.
